org.flixel
Class FlxText

java.lang.Object
  org.flixel.FlxPoint
      org.flixel.FlxRect
          org.flixel.FlxObject
              org.flixel.FlxSprite
                  org.flixel.FlxText

public class FlxText
extends FlxSprite

Extends FlxSprite to support rendering text. Can tint, fade, rotate and scale just like a sprite. Doesn't really animate though, as far as I know. Also does nice pixel-perfect centering on pixel fonts as long as they are only one liners.

               java.lang.String Text,
               boolean EmbeddedFont)
Creates a new FlxText object at the specified position.

Parameters:
X - The X position of the text.
Y - The Y position of the text.
Width - The width of the text object (height is determined automatically).
Text - The actual text you would like to display initially.
EmbeddedFont - Whether this text field uses embedded fonts or nto

Method Detail

setFormat

public FlxText setFormat(java.lang.String Font,
                         float Size,
                         int Color,
                         Align Alignment,
                         int ShadowColor)
You can use this if you have a lot of text parameters to set instead of the individual properties.

Parameters:
Font - The name of the font face for the text display.
Size - The size of the font (in pixels essentially).
Color - The color of the text in traditional flash 0xRRGGBB format.
Alignment - A int representing the desired alignment (Gravity.right e.g.);
ShadowColor - A uint representing the desired text shadow color in flash 0xRRGGBB format.
Returns:
This FlxText instance (nice for chaining stuff together, if you're into that).
